marathonWeb.title: Marathon Web
marathonWeb.presentation: Marathon Web is a project developed during a 24-hour hackathon as part of my Computer Science degree. The goal was to build a web platform allowing users to read interactive stories with multiple choices, in the style of 'choose-your-own-adventure' books. This intense challenge highlighted our ability to design a complete and interactive site in a very short timeframe.
marathonWeb.imageAlt: Screenshot of the Marathon Web homepage
marathonWeb.imageCaption: User interface of the Marathon Web platform
objectif: Develop a web platform in just 24 hours
Enable interactive reading of branching stories
Design a responsive layout for all devices
features: Interactive story system with branching paths
Navigation through different parts of a story
Responsive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile

architecture.description: The project follows Laravel's MVC architecture:
architecture.Model: Management of stories, users, and saves
architecture.Controller: Logic for processing choices and navigation

marathonWeb.challenges: The main challenge was to develop a complete and coherent project in just 24 hours. We had to quickly design a data structure suited to interactive stories, while ensuring a pleasant user experience and maintainable code.
marathonWeb.future: The project could be improved by adding a story editor for authors, a community rating system, or social features (comments, sharing). Rewriting it as a SPA using Vue or React would also improve performance and UX.
